block.p: Amy Dorothy DePoto and Robert Vincent Speranza were married yesterday afternoon by the Rev. Willie Raymond, a Roman Catholic priest, in the Memorial Chapel at Wesleyan University in Middletown, Conn.

Ms. Speranza, 27, is the manager of education services at the Securities Industry Association in New York, a trade group. She received a bachelor's degree and an M.B.A. from Babson College. She is a daughter of Joseph DePoto of North Haven, Conn. Her father retired as a sergeant in the North Haven Police Department.
Amy Dorothy DePoto and Robert Vincent Speranza were married yesterday afternoon by the Rev. Willie Raymond, a Roman Catholic priest, in the Memorial Chapel at Wesleyan University in Middletown, Conn.

Ms. Speranza, 27, is the manager of education services at the Securities Industry Association in New York, a trade group. She received a bachelor's degree and an M.B.A. from Babson College. She is a daughter of Joseph DePoto of North Haven, Conn. Her father retired as a sergeant in the North Haven Police Department.

Mr. Speranza, 28, is an associate marketing manager at the Pepsi-Cola Company in Purchase, N.Y. He graduated from Miami University, in Oxford, Ohio, and received an M.B.A. from Babson. He is the son of Ernest and Diann Speranza of Denville, N.J. His father is the senior vice president for international marketing at Toys ''R'' Us Inc. in Paramus, N.J. The bridegroom's mother is a board member at the Deirdre O'Brien Child Advocacy Center in Morristown, N.J.
